items.title: Wood Chip
items.description: Nanocellulose (a wood-derived material) is a viable alternative for semiconducting material (e.g. silicon) that make up the support layer (“substrate”) for today’s computer chips.

items.title: Silk Chip
items.description: Hwang et al. showed that silk (water-soluble, biodegradable) as substrate combined with other inorganic semiconductors can be used to build devices.

items.title: Algae Battery
items.description: Algae has the potential to be used as bio-batteries. It works similarly to typical solar cells; it captures sunlight, stores it, and converts it to electric current.
